comments.author: Abdussamad
comments.body: you're supposed to verify electrum before you run it. as for the issue of not connecting to a server the screenshot you posted shows electrum has connected to a server successfully. a green circle icon in the bottom right tells you that the connection was successful.

comments.author: Zaharai
comments.body: 7 times failed then connect to the server, connection was not stable hopefully conflicted with the system, Confused bug my OS or Electrum.How process runs i verified electrum for OS?

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: Zaharai on January 12, 2023, 08:22:40 AM7 times failed then connect to the server, connection was not stable hopefully conflicted with the system, Confused bug my OS or Electrum.How process runs i verified electrum for OS?Here's a guide that includes instructions for your OS: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5240594.0As for the connection to the server, your screenshot shows that your Electrum client is connected to a server.  As Abdussamad mentioned, the connection indicator is the litte circle in the lower right hand corner of the app window.  In the screenshot your circle is green, which means you are connected to a server via clear net.  A Tor connection would turn the circle blue, and if you aren't connected at all the circle would be red.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: Zaharai on January 12, 2023, 08:05:27 AMBug screenhttps://prnt.sc/mnHNjseGwF_N That's not a bug screen, and it doesn't show anything out of the ordinary. A bug screen would display a window with an error message.Quote from: Zaharai on January 12, 2023, 08:22:40 AM7 times failed then connect to the server, connection was not stable hopefully conflicted with the system, Confused bug my OS or Electrum. How was your overall internet connection disregarding the issues with Electrum at the time? Electrum connects to a random server from the list. You can change that and connect to one manually. If you go to Tools > Network, you should be able to see server settings there. Untick the "select server automatically" and pick a random server from the list. Try a few and see which ones work the best.
